result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Modrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain verifiable employment to the degree that it doesn't interfere with benefits.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with mother unless approved by agent and mother. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 16CF90.

Court Reporter:  Susan Armbruster. Defendant James R Modrow in court with attorney Gregory Holdahl.  Defendant James R Modrow in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

State indicates no Chapter 950 requirement, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Defense had no additions or corrections to revocation packet.  

State recommends 18 months IC & 2 years ES, consecutive to 16CF90.
Defense requests same, but concurrent to 16CF90.  

BTC:  WSP 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES)
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician.
Random UA's & breathalyzers
Counseling deemed appropriate by agent, including mental health counseling
Consecutive to 16CF90.
NOT eligible for CIP, eligible for SAT.
Firearms/voting warnings given.
Costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with calculation.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $950.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** No contact w/BP Gas Stations.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
